works.complaint:
We, the law firm of Bugge, Arentz-Hansen & Rasmussen  
(BA-HR, Oslo, Norway), represents REMA 1000 Norge AS (hereinafter "REMA  
1000"). REMA 1000 is one the leading grocery store chains in Norway. The  
Google AdSense advertisement on the above cited web page is advertising a  
consumer trivia competition in which it is claimed that gift certificates  
from i.a. Rema 1000 can be won. The advertisement utilizes REMA 1000’s  
trademarks without permission, thereby infringing REMA 1000’s trademark  
rights, cf. the Trade Mark Act § 4 (cf. below).  REMA 1000 has received  
several complaints regarding the advertisement and the associated consumer  
trivia competition from its customers, who believe that REMA 1000 is  
responsible. Being associated with the described operation is of course  
very harmful to the well established reputation of our client.

Our client is the owner of i.a. Norwegian trademark registration no  
238003 "REMA 1000" (word mark), for Nice classes: 3; 4; 5; 16; 20; 21; 28;  
29; 30; 31; 32; 35. The described unpermitted use of the REMA 1000  
trademark on the associated website constitutes clear infringement of our  
client’s exclusive right to utilisation of the REMA 1000 trademark in  
accordance with the Norwegian Trade Mark Act § 4. The unpermitted use  
creates risk of confusion, cf. article 4 paragraph 1 letter b. Moreover,  
our client’s mark undoubtedly has reputation (is well known) in Norway, and  
therefore enjoys extended protection pursuant to the Trade Mark act § 4  
paragraph 2, as the said use obviously takes unfair advantage of and is  
detrimental to the distinctive character and repute of the mark (only one  
of these alternative consequences is necessary for infringement).

Additionally, the advertisement also constitutes breach of other Norwegian  
laws, such as the Norwegian Marketing Control Act §§ 6–8, the Norwegian  
Lottery Act §§ 6 and 11 as well as the Norwegian Penal Code § 270 (fraud).

On these grounds we require that all use and references to our client and  
our client's trade mark REMA 1000 is immediately removed from the said  
advertisement, and that such illegal advertisement is removed from the  
cited website as well as on any other website it may appear. If our  
requirements are not met, we will have to consider applying for preliminary  
injunction against Google in Norway regarding the said infringements in  
order to have them removed.

For the sake of good order, this enquiry has also been sent to the  
following e-mail address: adsense-support@google.com

If you have any questions or would like us to elaborate further in respect  
of the above, please contact the undersigned on audol@bahr.no or by
